title: Grand Canyon National Park
introduction: A magnificent canyon located in Arizona, USA, renowned for its towering red cliffs, intricate rock formations, and panoramic desert vistas. A true marvel of nature offering unforgettable views and a sense of wonder.
policy: Entrance fees apply; no drones allowed; camping permits required.
description: this is an assignment relate to propulsion
openHour: Open year-round, 24 hours a day. Visitor centers open from 8 AM to 5 PM.

title: Great Barrier Reef
introduction: The world’s largest coral reef in Queensland, Australia, ideal for diving and marine life exploration.
policy: Snorkeling permits needed; protect coral; no fishing in protected zones.
description: this is an assignment relate to propulsion
openHour: Open year-round, with tours available daily from 8 AM to 5 PM. Best visiting months are from May to October.

title: Santorini
introduction: A Greek island known for its white houses, blue domes, and stunning sunsets over the Aegean Sea.
policy: Respect local customs; avoid crowded areas during peak times.
description: this is an assignment relate to propulsion
openHour: Open year-round. Tourist sites typically open from 9 AM to 7 PM. Peak season is from April to October.

title: Banff National Park
introduction: A Canadian park in Alberta with turquoise lakes, mountain views, and abundant wildlife.
policy: Park pass required; no feeding wildlife; follow trail guidelines.
description: this is an assignment relate to propulsion
openHour: Open year-round. Visitor centers are open from 9 AM to 5 PM. Summer months (June-August) are the busiest.

title: Maldives
introduction: A tropical paradise with clear waters, luxury resorts, and vibrant coral reefs.
policy: Visa-free for most; respect marine life; no collecting coral or shells.
description: this is an assignment relate to propulsion
openHour: Open year-round, with resorts and activities available daily. Peak season runs from November to April.

title: Mount Fuji
introduction: Japan’s iconic volcanic peak, known for its beauty and cultural significance.
policy: Hiking season is July-September; respect climbing regulations.
description: this is an assignment relate to propulsion
openHour: Open for climbing from early July to early September. Trails open from sunrise to sunset.

title: Eiffel Tower
introduction: An iconic iron tower offering panoramic views of Paris and a symbol of French art and culture.
policy: Tickets required for access; no large bags allowed.
description: A must-see landmark in Paris with breathtaking views of the city.
openHour: Open daily from 9:00 AM to 12:45 AM.

title: Machu Picchu
introduction: Ancient Incan city set high in the Andes mountains, offering incredible historical and scenic views.
policy: Tickets required; no drones allowed; respect the site’s heritage.
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, perfect for hiking and exploring ancient ruins.
openHour: Open daily from 6:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

title: Colosseum
introduction: A monumental amphitheater in Rome, known for its ancient gladiatorial contests and historical significance.
policy: Tickets required for entry; no large bags allowed.
description: An ancient Roman site showcasing architectural brilliance and historical culture.
openHour: Open daily from 8:30 AM to 7:00 PM.

title: Great Wall of China
introduction: A historic series of fortifications stretching across northern China, offering incredible views and ancient architecture.
policy: Tickets required; no littering; follow safety signs.
description: A symbol of China's ancient civilization and military prowess.
openHour: Open daily from 7:30 AM to 6:00 PM.

title: Pyramids of Giza
introduction: The last remaining ancient wonder of the world, known for their grandeur and historical significance.
policy: Tickets required; no climbing on the pyramids.
description: A majestic ancient site offering insight into Egypt’s incredible history.
openHour: Open daily from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

title: Taj Mahal
introduction: A beautiful white marble mausoleum and a symbol of love, attracting millions of visitors each year.
policy: Tickets required; no large bags or food allowed.
description: An architectural masterpiece and a UNESCO World Heritage site.
openHour: Open daily from 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM.

title: Aurora Borealis
introduction: A stunning natural light display visible in the Arctic regions, particularly in Tromsø, Norway.
policy: No special tickets required; respect the environment.
description: A natural wonder offering unforgettable views of the northern lights.
openHour: Visible from September to April, depending on weather conditions.

title: Acropolis of Athens
introduction: An ancient citadel featuring historic ruins, including the Parthenon, a symbol of Greek culture.
policy: Tickets required; no climbing on the ruins.
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site showcasing the rich history of Ancient Greece.
openHour: Open daily from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM.

title: Victoria Falls
introduction: One of the largest and most famous waterfalls in the world, straddling the border of Zambia and Zimbabwe.
policy: Entrance fee required; no swimming near the falls.
description: A natural wonder offering breathtaking views and wildlife experiences.
openHour: Open daily from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM.

title: Antelope Canyon
introduction: A stunning slot canyon famous for its wave-like rock formations and light beams.
policy: Guided tours required; no hiking without a guide.
description: A photographer’s paradise with unique natural beauty.
openHour: Open daily from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM.

title: Yellowstone National Park
introduction: America's first national park, known for its geothermal features, wildlife, and stunning landscapes.
policy: Park pass required; no feeding wildlife.
description: A vast park offering natural beauty and diverse wildlife.
openHour: Open year-round, with park facilities operating from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

title: Stonehenge
introduction: A prehistoric monument consisting of massive stone structures, with mysterious origins.
policy: Tickets required; no climbing on the stones.
description: A fascinating ancient site with a rich history and cultural significance.
openHour: Open daily from 9:00 AM to 7:00 PM.

title: Galápagos Islands
introduction: A remote archipelago known for its unique wildlife and biodiversity, ideal for nature lovers.
policy: Permits required for certain areas; respect wildlife.
description: A pristine environment perfect for wildlife watching and eco-tourism.
openHour: Open year-round, with tours available from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM.

title: Alhambra
introduction: A stunning palace and fortress complex known for its Islamic architecture and lush gardens.
policy: Tickets required; no photography inside some areas.
description: A symbol of Moorish culture and a UNESCO World Heritage site.
openHour: Open daily from 8:30 AM to 8:00 PM.

title: Angkor Wat
introduction: A massive temple complex, one of the largest religious monuments in the world, known for its intricate carvings.
policy: Tickets required; no climbing on the temples.
description: A stunning site that blends history, culture, and religious significance.
openHour: Open daily from 5:00 AM to 6:00 PM.

title: Banff Lake Louise
introduction: A stunning lake surrounded by snow-capped mountains, offering a peaceful and scenic retreat.
policy: Park pass required; no motorized boats on the lake.
description: A picture-perfect destination for nature lovers and outdoor enthusiasts.
openHour: Open year-round, with visitor services from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

title: Mount Kilimanjaro
introduction: The highest mountain in Africa, known for its glaciers, volcanic cones, and diverse ecosystems.
policy: Permits required for climbing; no littering.
description: A challenging yet rewarding climb with breathtaking views at the summit.
openHour: Climbing season is from June to October.

title: Sydney Opera House
introduction: An architectural masterpiece and one of the most recognizable landmarks in the world, known for its performances.
policy: Tickets required for performances; no photography during shows.
description: A world-class venue for music, theater, and cultural events.
openHour: Open daily from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM, with performances in the evening.

title: Bora Bora
introduction: A tropical island paradise, famous for its clear turquoise waters, luxury resorts, and coral reefs.
policy: Respect local culture; no collecting coral or shells.
description: A dream destination for relaxation, luxury, and water sports.
openHour: Open year-round, with resorts and activities available daily.

title: Iguazu Falls
introduction: One of the largest and most impressive waterfall systems in the world, located on the border of Argentina and Brazil.
policy: Tickets required; no swimming near the falls.
description: A magnificent natural wonder with spectacular views and hiking trails.
openHour: Open daily from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM.
